title: CaribbeanPools.com Redesign & Digital Platform Evolution
tagline: I led Caribbean Pools' digital evolution—building its first e-commerce platform, ShopCaribbeanPools.com, and later redesigning CaribbeanPools.com in 2025 to unify both into a cohesive customer experience. The overhaul modernized UX, clarified the service journey, and turned the company's websites into active revenue engines instead of static brochures.

hero.alt: Caribbean Pools website and e-commerce platform

context.problem: The legacy CaribbeanPools.com was showing its age. Navigation was confusing, the design wasn't responsive, and content updates required developer intervention. The tone didn't reflect the premium feel of our in-store experience, and the ShopCaribbeanPools site existed as a separate ecosystem—two brands that didn't talk to each other. We needed to unify everything under one visual and functional system: a single digital identity that could educate, inspire, and transact.
constraints: Navigation was confusing and not user-friendly
Design wasn't responsive for mobile devices
Two separate sites (CaribbeanPools.com and ShopCaribbeanPools.com) with disconnected branding
Tone didn't reflect premium in-store experience

solution.approach: I approached the project as both designer and systems integrator. The new site functioned like a living brand hub—marketing, retail, and service all under one consistent design system.
bullets: Platform refresh: Migrated both sites to a modern WordPress framework with modular block components, allowing quick page builds and future scalability
Unified UX system: Merged e-commerce functionality from ShopCaribbeanPools into the main site with consistent navigation, typography, and color palette
Process-based storytelling: Reorganized content around Design → Build → Maintain, visually mapping the full customer journey
E-commerce optimization: Rebuilt product cards and checkout flow for mobile use, simplifying forms and improving load time by ~45%
Visual integration: Pulled imagery from my drone and print studio projects—giving customers a seamless experience from ad to purchase
Team enablement: Created pre-styled content blocks and trained staff to manage updates in-house, removing the dependency on external developers
